obfuscation: ﻿The Shoggoth I had met Professor Kindle during my explorations in my youth in Berlin at a convention .
original:
﻿The Shoggoth
I had met Professor Kindle during my explorations in my youth in Berlin at a convention.

obfuscation: His theories in such subjects as physics and anatomy were peculiar to me-and to his chagrin-his colleges as well .
original: His theories in such subjects as physics and anatomy were peculiar to me-and to his chagrin-his colleges as well.

obfuscation: '' Well , my boy , '' He said upon my asking why everyone seemed to mock him .
original: "Well, my boy," He said upon my asking why everyone seemed to mock him.

obfuscation: `` These fools do not wish to see what 's so apparent that if it were a snake , it would most assuredly bite them . ''
original: "These fools do not wish to see what's so plain that if it were a snake, it would most assuredly bite them."

obfuscation: Upon that introduction , he had began to tell me how certain miniscule particles held the universe together .
original: Upon that introduction, he had began to tell me how certain miniscule particles held the universe together.

obfuscation: What he said went beyond dark matter and such unexplained universal secrets that it was almost arduous to believe .
original: What he said went beyond dark matter and such unexplained universal secrets that it was almost hard to believe.

original: But I can tell you, he was convincing.

original: A fact that will later cause me to rethink my pursuits.

original: "You see, my boy, Yog-Sothoth particles and Azathoth particles exist in sub matter, in a way that can go undetected even more so than the elusive dark matter for it obviously does not refract or twist light in any such matter like anything else in space."

obfuscation: '' Then how does one know of their existence ? ''
original: "Then how does one know of their existence?"

original: I asked, and for the fourth time: "And why those names?"

original: It was odd to me to think that such a thing would exist that does not interact upon its surroundings.

original: He smiled.

original: A book I doubt you have read, but the names fit, believe me.

original: For you see, Azathoth represents chaos, and Yog-Sothoth order; it's like the Chinese philosophy of Yin and Yang, a philosophy I find as very true."
